# baseWritingDirection(for:in:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the base writing direction for a position in the text going in a certain direction.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func baseWritingDirection(for position: UITextPosition, in direction: UITextStorageDirection) -> NSWritingDirection
```

## Parameters

- **position**: An object that identifies a location in a document.
- **direction**: A constant that indicates a direction of storage (forward or backward).

## Return Value

A constant that represents a writing direction (for example, left-to-right or right-to-left).

## Discussion

The base writing direction is set previously when the text input system sends a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextInput/setBaseWritingDirection(_:for:)] message to the conforming document object.

## Determining layout and writing direction

- **position(within:farthestIn:)**: Returns the text position that is at the farthest extent in a specified layout direction within a range of text.
- **characterRange(byExtending:in:)**: Returns a text range from a specified text position to its farthest extent in a certain direction of layout.
- **setBaseWritingDirection(_:for:)**: Sets the base writing direction for a specified range of text in a document.
